AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero: Defendant involved in a case of reckless endangerment and death enhancements while transporting unlawful aliens into the United States, with a base offense level enhanced due to the death of Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez. Argued against sentence enhancement under reckless endangerment guideline.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.KING: Chief Judge presiding over the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez: Undocumented female alien who died due to heat stroke during transportation by Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jaime Gomez-Arroyo: Met with border patrol agents after the death of his niece, Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, Alma Delia Si: Group of nine aliens guided by Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero for financial gain
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Cuyler: referenced in a case regarding reckless conduct in the transportation of illegal aliens, where the offense conduct at issue was transporting unrestrained aliens in the bed of a pickup truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Rodriguez: defendants in a case involving guiding illegal aliens into the United States via the mountains between Mexico and San Diego
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero and others: defendants involved in cases related to the transportation of undocumented aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Herrera: court in the Ninth Circuit that addressed whether intent is required for an enhancement under a specific subsection and made a statement regarding causal connection between offense conduct and death or injury in a footnote
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Defendants in Rodriguez case: guides employed by alien smugglers to transport illegal aliens into the United States via the mountains between Mexico and San Diego for financial gain
